message_1: What is the percent yield of a reaction if 5.5 grams of product were obtained from the reaction of 7.8 grams of reactant and the theoretical yield of the product is 9.2 grams?
message_2:
The percent yield of a reaction can be calculated using the following formula:

Percent Yield = (Actual Yield / Theoretical Yield) x 100

In this case, the actual yield is 5.5 grams, and the theoretical yield is 9.2 grams. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Percent Yield = (5.5 / 9.2) x 100

Percent Yield = 0.5978 x 100

Percent Yield â‰ˆ 59.78%

So, the percent yield of the reaction is approximately 59.78%.
